content: I want to change the identifier only in a single namespace / given scope.
What do you mean? The right click change all occurrences doesn't really do that either right?
I don't know about VSCode, but in Visual studio it does. At least for C#.
I would imagine that is an LSP feature, so is in principle possible for Lean 4, is that what you are using?
No, I haven't switched from Lean 3 yet. What is LSP?

Martin Dvořák said:

I don't know about VSCode, but in Visual studio it does. At least for C#.

It is IMHO pretty important for working with C#. C# has contextual keywords. Fulltext find and replace could cause a disaster.
LSP is https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Language_Server_Protocol, which is what Lean 4 uses to implement smart editor features I believe (where as Lean 3 is more bespoke)
We understand why you think it is important, and everybody agrees. But it doesn't exist in Lean 3 and will exist in Lean 4.
Martin Dvořák has marked this topic as resolved.
Just to make things confusing, LSP also stands for Lean Server Protocol in Lean 3, right?

Eric Wieser said:

Just to make things confusing, LSP also stands for Lean Server Protocol in Lean 3, right?

I don't think I've seen the abbreviation LSP used for Lean 3's server protocol; certainly I've always tried to avoid it because of the potential for confusion.
"Change all occurrences" relies on "Find all occurrences", which is super useful by itself
